    },
    {
      "organization": "Environmental Defense Fund",
      "role": "Environmental Politics",
      "location": null,
      "start_date": null,
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Worked on influencing decision-making with scientific analysis",
      "supporting_quotes": ["Then he charged headlong into environmental politics with the Environmental Defense Fund.", "\"I learned how to influence decision-making with good science,\" El-Ashry says. \"We didn't work on gut feelings, but with good scientific analysis.\""]
    },

      "organization": "Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA)",
      "role": "Director of Environmental Quality",
      "location": null,
      "start_date": null,
      "end_date": "1983",
      "description": "Led efforts to reduce sulfur dioxide emissions",
      "supporting_quotes": ["He was recruited as director of environmental quality for the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA)a utility that was, at the time, \"the worst polluter in the United States,\" he says.", "With El-Ashry's guidance, the TVA set the ambitious goal of reducing by 50 percent sulfur dioxide emissions that contribute to acid rain."]
    },

      "organization": "World Resources Institute",
      "role": "Builder/Leader",
      "location": null,

    },

      "organization": "World Bank",
      "role": "Chief Environmental Adviser and Director of Environment",
      "location": null,
      "start_date": null,
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Helped establish the Global Environment Facility (GEF)",
      "supporting_quotes": ["Next, El-Ashry served as chief environmental adviser to the President and became director of environment for the World Bank, where he made what he considers his greatest mark. He helped establish the Global Environment Facility (GEF),"]
    },

      "organization": "Global Environment Facility (GEF)",
      "role": "CEO and Chairman",
      "location": null,
      "start_date": "1994",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Led GEF in funding projects on biodiversity, international waters, and renewable energy",
      "supporting_quotes": ["In 1994, El-Ashry became the first CEO and chairman of GEF, which funds projects on biodiversity, international waters and renewable energy in developing countries."]
    }
  ]
}
